question: 今度
sourceMnemonic: In the <kanji>now</kanji> <kanji>occurrence</kanji> you'll learn your kanji, no? This word means <vocabulary>this time</vocabulary>. Despite being "this time" it has the feeling of <vocabulary>next time</vocabulary>, though. It's like saying "okay, this time we'll get it" where "this time" really means "next time," making it a little bit different from <ja>今回</ja>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
